name: Iowa National Guard Service Scholarship (INGSS)
description: Annual awards up to $9,034 per academic year (2024-2025) for Iowa National Guard members at eligible Iowa colleges and universities. Can be combined with Federal Student Aid, Federal Tuition Assistance, and GI Bill. Covers up to 120 credit hours (130 for STEM degrees) or bachelor's degree. Guard members who mobilize receive tuition refund. Maximum award: 100% of Iowa Board of Regents resident tuition OR 100% of institution's tuition (whichever lower).
eligibility: Current Iowa National Guard member in good standing
benefit_amount: Up to $9,034/year (2024-2025) + tuition refund if mobilized
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa National Guard Education Office

name: Branstad-Reynolds Scholarship Fund
description: Post-secondary scholarships for children of deceased service members who died while in active military status after September 11, 2001. Subsidizes tuition, books, fees, housing, special tools and equipment. Deadline December 31 annually. Up to $11,844 per year.
eligibility: Child of deceased service member (death after 9/11/2001 in active status)
Death does not have to be combat-related
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa Department of Veterans Affairs by December 31

name: War Orphans Educational Aid
description: For dependents of Iowa veterans killed in action BEFORE September 11, 2001: up to $600 per year with maximum $3,000 total. For children up to age 26.
eligibility: Dependent child of Iowa veteran KIA before 9/11/2001
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa Department of Veterans Affairs

name: In-State Tuition for Active Duty, Veterans, and Dependents
description: Iowa automatically applies in-state tuition rates to currently serving active duty, spouses, dependent children, domestic partners, AND full-time Guard/Reserve members plus dependents/spouses. Significant savings for military families.
eligibility: Documentation: military ID, PCS orders, marriage certificate, tax return (dependents)
how_to_apply: Submit required military documentation to Iowa institution

name: Iowa Military Property Tax Exemption
description: Reduces veteran's assessed home value by $1,852 for property tax purposes. Available since 1947. No annual reapplication required (may need to list on tax form).
eligibility: Honorably discharged AND: 18+ months active duty OR service-connected injury discharge
OR served during qualifying wartime period
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor once; no annual reapplication required

name: Disabled Veteran's Homestead Tax Credit (100% Exemption)
description: 100% property tax exemption for 100% service-connected disabled veterans and DIC recipients. Enacted 2014. Do NOT have to reapply annually.
eligibility: OR Dependency and Indemnity Compensation recipient
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor using Form 54-049; no annual reapplication

name: Injured Veterans Grant
description: Up to $10,000 grant for veterans seriously injured in line of duty after September 11, 2001. Injury must be combat-related in combat/hostile fire zone, requiring medical evacuation OR 30+ consecutive days hospitalization at military hospital. Must be Iowa resident or Iowa National Guard member. Grant remains available after discharge if continuing treatment.
eligibility: Iowa resident OR Iowa National Guard member
In combat zone or hostile fire zone
Medical evacuation OR 30+ days military hospital
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Homeownership Assistance Grant
description: $5,000 grant for service members who served after September 11, 2001 and purchased home after March 10, 2005. Also available to some who served 90+ days between August 2, 1990 and April 6, 1991. Must have prior approval before closing. Subject to funding availability. Can be used with Iowa FirstHome and Homes For Iowans programs.
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa Finance Authority before closing

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: Military retired pay included in federal gross income is exempt from Iowa income tax. In ADDITION to general $6,000/$12,000 pension exclusion for 55+ taxpayers. Example: married 65-year-old with $20K military retired pay + $25K pension = $32K exclusion ($20K + $12K).
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military retirement + standard pension exclusion
how_to_apply: Exclude from Iowa income tax return

name: Active Duty Military Pay Tax Exemption
description: Members of U.S. Armed Forces, Reserves, and National Guard in active duty status do NOT pay Iowa income tax on their military pay.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on active duty military pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from Iowa income tax return

name: Survivor Benefit Plan Tax Exemption
description: Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) payments are exempt from Iowa income tax.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Iowa income tax return

name: Guard/Reserve Active Duty Retirement Withdrawal Exemption
description: Guard members activated for federal/state active duty and Reserve members mobilized for federal active duty can withdraw funds from qualified retirement accounts without Iowa state income tax or state penalties (federal taxes still apply).
eligibility: Iowa National Guard activated for federal/state duty
OR Reserve member mobilized for federal duty
benefit_amount: No Iowa income tax or penalties on retirement withdrawals during activation
how_to_apply: Report on Iowa income tax return with military orders documentation

name: Income Tax Forgiveness for Deceased Service Members
description: Iowa income tax forgiven if service member's federal taxes were forgiven due to: killed outside U.S. by terrorist act/military action OR declared missing and presumed dead. Single: forgiven for year of death and prior year. Heirs can request refunds for taxes paid while on active duty (within 7 years).
eligibility: Iowa service member killed outside U.S. (terrorism/military)
OR declared missing and presumed dead
OR heirs of qualifying deceased service member
how_to_apply: Contact Iowa Department of Revenue with military documentation

name: Veterans Employment Preference Points
description: Veterans receive 5 preference points for state and local government jobs. Veterans with service-connected disability receive 10 preference points. Does NOT apply to promotions or reassignments, only hiring. Qualifying spouses also eligible for 5 points.
eligibility: Iowa veteran (5 points) OR disabled veteran (10 points)
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state/local employment applications with DD-214

name: Military Spouse Professional License Portability
description: State agencies issue licenses WITHOUT EXAMINATION to military spouses licensed in good standing in another state, provided no disqualifying criminal history.
eligibility: Professional license in good standing from another state
how_to_apply: Contact Iowa professional licensing board with spouse documentation and out-of-state license

name: Iowa Workforce Development Veteran Employment Services
description: 15 regional offices around Iowa with staff coordinating veteran services within Iowa Workforce system. Helps clients of VA Vocational Rehabilitation. Career services, job search assistance, and training programs.
benefit_amount: Free employment services and career assistance (15 regional offices)
how_to_apply: Contact Iowa Workforce Development regional office

name: Lifetime Hunting and Fishing License ($7)
description: Veterans with ANY VA disability rating (0% or higher) can apply for lifetime hunting and fishing license for only $7. Must be Iowa resident with VA-rated disability from active duty service.
eligibility: ANY VA disability rating (0% or higher)
how_to_apply: Apply through Iowa DNR with VA disability documentation

name: Iowa State Veterans Cemetery
description: Located west of Des Moines in Adel. Military members, qualifying spouses, and dependent children have burial privileges. NO FEE for veterans. Others require interment fee. Eligibility: discharge not characterized as dishonorable OR died on active duty OR 20+ years Guard/Reserve qualified for retirement.
eligibility: Spouses and dependent children also eligible
benefit_amount: FREE burial for veterans; interment fee for others
how_to_apply: Contact Iowa State Veterans Cemetery in Adel

name: Veteran Designation on Driver's License/ID
description: Honorably discharged veterans may request 'Veteran' designation on their Iowa driver's license or state-issued identification card.
how_to_apply: Request at Iowa DOT when renewing/obtaining license with DD-214
